revised_title: Secondary Electromotor Power of Nerves and Its Application to Electro-Physiological Phenomena
tldr: The author investigates the secondary electromotor power of nerves and its application to explain certain electro-physiological phenomena. They discover that nerves acquire a secondary electromotor power when traversed by an electric current, which can produce an electric current in the opposite direction in a conducting circuit. This phenomenon is independent of the vital properties of the nerves and can be observed in both living and dead animals.
